msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Added row/column visibility tracking to Vertical,HorizontalLayout.
This is an incremental change aimed at enabling step/page scrolling
Added new bindable read-only properties firstIndexInView and
lastIndexInView to VerticalLayout.  They track the first/last row
that's within the layout target's scrollRect and included in the
layout.  Note that any other row within this range may not actually be
"in view" (or visible) because its item could be null or
Added a VerticalLayout method called inView that reports if a
particular row is "in view" or partially so.
Made comparable changes to HorizontalLayout, HGroup.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
- Added HGroup and VGroup wrappers for Group+Horizontal,VerticalLayout.
- Removed the provisional support for specifying layout with a
classname string.  The type of the layout property in Group
and in ItemsComponent is now ILayout.
More about the rationale for this change here:
Now, one must either use HGroup,VGroup or an explicit layout tag.
This change will affect most MXML files.  Upgrading is pretty easy.
The Panel and Application classes, whose default layout is BasicLayout,
have to be upgraded with an additional layout element, as in the
Substantially revised ScrollerSkin's measure and updateDisplayList
methods. The latter now calls invalidateSize (on itself!) if the
visibility of either scrollbar changes.  This causes the measure
method to compute new values for measuredWidth,Height based on the new
visibility state for the scrollbars.  When the scroll policy is "auto"
the Scroller's measured size includes space for the visible
Note also: the logic for calling updateDisplayList and then restarting
the process if the component has become invalid is in
- Removed the protected Group invalidateSizeAndLayout() method.
QE: This change will break many existing tests
SDK-16782 -  ScrollBars overlap content in Scroller
